books.title: Six Characters in Search of an Author
books.author: Luigi Pirandello
books.summary: An absurdist comedy that contrasts illusion with reality, in which six characters arrive on a rehearsal stage filled with actors and demand the chance to speak their lines and act out the story of their lives.

books.title: The Courts of the Morning
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: A Scottish laird foments rebellion in a South American country threatened by a hostile regime.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Gold Bat
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The boys of Wrykyn School battle to defend their honor against rival sports teams and enemies from within.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: Richard II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Richard II’s wasteful spending habits drive his supporters to revolt.

books.title: A Voyage to Arcturus
books.author: David Lindsay
books.summary: One man’s journey through a psychedelic alien landscape of philosophy, religion, life, and death.

books.title: The Adventures of Captain Hatteras
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A mysterious captain assembles a ship and crew for a secret and dangerous voyage.

books.title: The Case of Charles Dexter Ward
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: A young scholar delves into his family past and finds more than he bargained for.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Thus Spake Zarathustra
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: After ten years spent in solitude, Zarathustra goes back amongst men to share his accumulated wisdom and prepare humanity for the Overman.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by H. Beam Piper ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Jonas Lie
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Norwegian author Jonas Lie, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
